meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.enactingFormula: (Made by the Chief Executive in Council under sections 2A and 12 of the Civil Aviation Ordinance (Cap. 448))

section.name: s1
section.heading: Commencement

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Order comes into operation on 1 June 2022.
Section 12(2)(c) comes into operation on a day to be appointed by the Director-General of Civil Aviation by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means—(a)a public officer or any other person appointed under section 48; or(b)a police officer;
category A1 aircraft (甲一類無人機)—see section 3(2)(a);
category A2 aircraft (甲二類無人機)—see section 3(2)(b);
category B aircraft (乙類無人機)—see section 3(2)(c);
category C aircraft (丙類無人機)—see section 3(2)(d); (L.N. 82 of 2025)

dangerous goods (危險品), in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight—(a)means any of the goods or substances to which the Dangerous Goods Ordinance (Cap. 295) applies under section 3 of that Ordinance; but(b)does not include any of those goods or substances—(i)that are used as or form part of the power source of the aircraft for the flight;(ii)that are necessary to be carried by the aircraft for the flight for complying with section 11(1)(d); or(iii)that are otherwise necessary for the aircraft to be fit for flying;
designated information system (指定資訊系統)—see section 67;
Director (處長) means the Director-General of Civil Aviation;
enclosed area (圍封範圍)—see section 6;
flight (飛行)—see section 5;
operate (操作)—see section 4;
operating requirement (操作規定) means—(a)a requirement set out in section 16(1) or (1A); or (L.N. 82 of 2025)(b)a requirement specified by the Director under section 17(1);
prescribed fee (訂明費用), in relation to a matter, means a fee prescribed for the matter in the Schedule;
proof of identity (身分證明文件) has the meaning given by section 17B(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115);
registered remote pilot (註冊遙控駕駛員) means a person who is registered under section 29 and whose registration is in force;
remote pilot (遙控駕駛員), in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight, means the natural person who operates the aircraft for the flight;
responsible person (負責人), in relation to a small unmanned aircraft, means the person who is named under section 25(5)(a) as the responsible person of the aircraft;
small unmanned aircraft (小型無人機)—see section 3(1);
SUA registration certificate (小型無人機註冊證書) means an SUA registration certificate issued under section 25(5)(b) or 26(5)(a);

unmanned aircraft (無人機) means a power driven machine that can derive support in the atmosphere from the reactions of the air other than the reactions of the air against the earth’s surface, which is operated with no pilot on board.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Small unmanned aircraft and its classification

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Order, an unmanned aircraft is a small unmanned aircraft in respect of a flight if its weight does not exceed 150 kg at all times during the flight.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is a category A1 aircraft in respect of a flight if its weight does not exceed 250 g at all times during the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is a category A2 aircraft in respect of a flight if its weight does not exceed 7 kg at all times during the flight but exceeds 250 g at any time during the flight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is a category B aircraft in respect of a flight if its weight does not exceed 25 kg at all times during the flight but exceeds 7 kg at any time during the flight; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is a category C aircraft in respect of a flight if its weight exceeds 25 kg at any time during the flight. (L.N. 82 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: In determining the weight of an aircraft for subsections (1) and (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: everything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft is to be taken into account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the flight is partly within Hong Kong and partly outside Hong Kong—the part of the flight outside Hong Kong is not to be taken into account.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of operate etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Order, a person operates a small unmanned aircraft for a flight if the person conducts the flight of the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by operating its flight controls manually; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the aircraft flies automatically during the flight—by monitoring the aircraft’s course and remaining able to intervene and change the aircraft’s course at any time during the flight.

subsection.content: References to “a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight” and “operation” are to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of flight
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Order, a flight of a small unmanned aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins at the time when any component of the aircraft first moves for the purpose of taking off; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ends at the time when the aircraft next comes to rest.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meaning of enclosed area
section.content: For the purposes of this Order, a flight of a small unmanned aircraft is within an enclosed area if the area is surrounded on all sides by fixed or movable walls, ceiling, structures or other barriers that effectively prevent the aircraft from leaving the area during the flight.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Application to flight within Hong Kong

subsection.content: This Part applies to or in relation to a small unmanned aircraft in respect of a flight that is wholly within Hong Kong.

If a flight of a small unmanned aircraft is partly within Hong Kong and partly outside Hong Kong, this Part applies to or in relation to the aircraft only in respect of the part of the flight that is within Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are subject to sections 8, 9 and 10; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have no effect in relation to the scope of application of section 16(1A). (L.N. 82 of 2025)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Limited application to flight within enclosed area of domestic premises

subsection.content: This Part (other than Division 3) does not apply to or in relation to a small unmanned aircraft in respect of a flight that is wholly within an enclosed area of any domestic premises.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: domestic premises (住宅) means any premises used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Limited application to flight operation for educational or research purposes

subsection.leadIn: This Part (other than Division 3) does not apply to or in relation to a category A1 aircraft or category A2 aircraft in respect of a flight if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aircraft is operated for the flight for educational or research purposes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the flight is wholly within the school premises of a specified school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight is within the school premises of the school at all times during the flight;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the flying altitude of the aircraft is not higher than the flying altitude specified under subsection (2) at any time during the flight;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the aircraft is not carrying any dangerous goods at any time during the flight;

subparagraph.content: the aircraft is a registered small unmanned aircraft; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the label issued by the Director under section 25(5)(e) in respect of the aircraft—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is displayed on the external surface of the aircraft; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is clearly visible; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: for a flight within a restricted flying zone—

subparagraph.content: the flight is wholly within an enclosed area; or
the aircraft is operated for the flight in accordance with a permission granted under section 37 in respect of the restricted flying zone.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), the Director must, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a flying altitude.
The Director may specify different flying altitudes for different categories, classes or descriptions of unmanned aircraft.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke a specification made under subsection (2).
Any notice published under subsection (2) or (4) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: school premises (校舍) includes school recreation rooms, residential facilities, playing fields and playing grounds, and any other places used for the purposes of a school;

specified school (指明學校) means—(a)a primary school as defined by section 3(1) of the Education Ordinance (Cap. 279);(b)a secondary school as defined by that section;(c)a special school as defined by that section;(d)a school that is approved under section 18A(1) of that Ordinance to provide post secondary education;(e)an institution set out in section 2 of that Ordinance; or(f)a school operated or managed by the Hong Kong Arts Centre referred to in section 3 of the Hong Kong Arts Centre Ordinance (Cap. 304).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Limited application to category A1 aircraft
section.leadIn: Subdivision 1 of Division 2 does not apply to or in relation to a category A1 aircraft in respect of a flight if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aircraft is operated in compliance with all operating requirements applicable to the aircraft at all times during the flight (unless the flight is wholly within an enclosed area);

subparagraph.content: is not within a restricted flying zone at any time during the flight; or
is within a restricted flying zone at any time during the flight, but the flight is wholly within an enclosed area; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the aircraft is not carrying any dangerous goods at any time during the flight.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Basic requirements for operating small unmanned aircraft for flights

subsection.leadIn: A small unmanned aircraft may only be operated for a flight if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aircraft is a registered small unmanned aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the label issued by the Director under section 25(5)(e) in respect of the aircraft—

subparagraph.content: is displayed on the external surface of the aircraft; and
is clearly visible;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is in force an insurance policy specified in section 12(1) in respect of the flight;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a safety system capable of performing all the functions specified in section 13 (whether set out in section 13(1) or specified under section 13(2)) (specified functions)—

subparagraph.content: is installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft, the device used to control the aircraft for the flight, or a component associated with the aircraft or the device; and
is in use with all the specified functions functioning at all times during the flight;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight is a registered remote pilot;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the remote pilot’s rating permits the remote pilot to conduct the type of flight operation to which the flight operation belongs; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for a category B aircraft or category C aircraft—the aircraft is operated for the flight in accordance with a permission granted under section 37. (L.N. 82 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: However—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(c), (d), (e) and (f) does not apply if the flight is wholly within an enclosed area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subsection (1)(f) does not apply if the aircraft is operated for the flight as part of—

subparagraph.content: a training course approved under section 35(1)(a); or
an assessment conducted by a person authorized under section 35(1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: Also, subsection (1)(c) does not apply if the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a category A2 aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is operated for the flight in compliance with the conditions specified in section 12(3).

subsection.leadIn: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight in contravention of subsection (1), each of the following persons commits an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person of the aircraft at the time of the flight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who knowingly causes or permits the aircraft to be operated for the flight.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
Subsection (3) expires at midnight on the day on which section 12(2)(c) comes into operation.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Insurance policy specified for section 11(1)(c)

subsection.leadIn: The insurance policy specified for the purposes of section 11(1)(c) is a policy that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: insures against any liability that may be incurred in respect of the death of, or bodily injury to, a third party—

subparagraph.content: arising out of or caused by the operation of the aircraft for the flight in Hong Kong; and
arising out of any one event;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a coverage of not less than the amount specified in subsection (2) in respect of the liability described in paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.content: an authorized insurer; or
if the insured under the policy is a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong—an insurer accepted by the Director under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The amount specified for subsection (1)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for a category B aircraft—$10,000,000; (L.N. 82 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: if its weight does not exceed 75 kg at all times during the flight—$15,000,000; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for any other category A2 aircraft—$5,000,000.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aircraft is operated in compliance with all operating requirements applicable to the aircraft at all times during the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the aircraft is not within a restricted flying zone at any time during the flight; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the aircraft is not carrying any dangerous goods at any time during the flight.

subsection.content: The Director may accept any insurer for the purposes of subsection (1)(c)(ii).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(c)(i)—
subsection.def: authorized insurer (獲授權保險人) means—(a)an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);(b)an association of underwriters approved by the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of that Ordinance; or(c)the society of underwriters known in the United Kingdom as Lloyd’s.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Functions of safety system specified for section 11(1)(d)

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight, the functions specified for the purposes of section 11(1)(d) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the function of indicating the geographical location, flying altitude and flying speed of the aircraft (relevant information) in real time to the remote pilot of the aircraft during the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the function of giving alert to the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight in real time in relation to any flying restriction as set in the safety system;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the function of recording the relevant information during the flight; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the function of recording the date on which and the time at which the relevant information is recorded.

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 11(1)(d), the Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any other function that the Director considers it necessary in the interests of aviation safety or public safety.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke a specification made under subsection (2).
Any notice published under subsection (2) or (3) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Duty to keep information recorded by safety system

subsection.content: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight that is not wholly within an enclosed area, the information recorded by a safety system as required under section 11(1)(d) in connection with the flight must be kept for 6 months beginning on the date on which the flight begins.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight in accordance with a permission granted under section 37, the information recorded by a safety system as required under section 11(1)(d) in connection with the flight—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be kept for 6 months beginning on the date on which the flight begins; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accessible in Hong Kong by an authorized officer. (L.N. 82 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) or (1A) is contravened, each of the following persons commits an offence— (L.N. 82 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person of the aircraft at the time of the flight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who knowingly causes or permits the aircraft to be operated for the flight.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Operating requirements must be complied with during operation

subsection.content: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight, it must be operated in compliance with all operating requirements applicable to the aircraft at all times during the flight.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the flight is wholly within an enclosed area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aircraft is operated for the flight in accordance with a permission granted under section 37.

subsection.content: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight in contravention of subsection (1), the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Requirements for operation

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 15(1), the requirements applicable to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aircraft is not operated for the flight at the specified hours of a day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a visual line of sight is maintained with the aircraft in a specified way;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the flying altitude of the aircraft is not higher than the specified flying altitude;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the flying speed of the aircraft does not exceed the specified flying speed;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: that the distance between the aircraft and any vehicle, vessel or structure that is not under the control of the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight, measured horizontally and at any altitude, is not less than the specified distance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: that the distance between the aircraft and the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight does not exceed the specified distance;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: that the aircraft does not carry any person or animal during the flight;
that nothing is dropped from the aircraft during the flight except for specified purpose;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: that the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight operates no more than the specified number of unmanned aircraft at the same time; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: that the dimension of the aircraft (including everything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft) does not exceed the specified dimension at all times during the flight.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Moreover, for the purposes of section 15(1), it is also a requirement applicable to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight that the flight is wholly within Hong Kong. (L.N. 82 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: drop (掉下) includes project and lower;
specified (指明) means specified by the Director under section 17(2).

section.name: s17
section.heading: Power to specify other requirements and parameters etc. for operating requirements

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 15(1), the Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any other requirement that the Director considers it necessary in the interests of aviation safety or public safety.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any of the parameters or matters for the requirements set out in section 16(1).
The Director may specify different requirements, parameters or matters for different categories, classes or descriptions of unmanned aircraft.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke a specification made under subsection (1) or (2).
Any notice published under subsection (1), (2) or (4) is not subsidiary legislation.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Additional Requirements for Flights within Restricted Flying Zone

section.name: s18
section.heading: Permission required for flights within restricted flying zone

subsection.content: If any part of a flight of a small unmanned aircraft is within a restricted flying zone, the aircraft may only be operated for the flight in accordance with a permission granted under section 37 in respect of the restricted flying zone.
However, subsection (1) does not apply if the flight is wholly within an enclosed area.

subsection.leadIn: If a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight in contravention of subsection (1), each of the following persons commits an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remote pilot of the aircraft for the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person of the aircraft at the time of the flight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who knowingly causes or permits the aircraft to be operated for the flight.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Power to designate restricted flying zones

subsection.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an area in Hong Kong (including the airspace above the area) as a restricted flying zone for the purposes of section 18(1) if the Director considers it necessary in the interests of aviation safety.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner of Police may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an area in Hong Kong (including the airspace above the area) as a restricted flying zone for the purposes of section 18(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner considers that there is an occurrence of an emergency in the area;

subparagraph.content: there is likely to be a gathering or movement of a large number of persons in the area; and
it is necessary to designate the area as a restricted flying zone for ensuring public safety or public order in the area; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Commissioner otherwise considers it necessary to designate the area as a restricted flying zone for performing the duties of the police force under section 10 of the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

subsection.content: Without limiting the powers of the Commissioner of Police under subsection (2), the Secretary for Security may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an area in Hong Kong (including the airspace above the area) as a restricted flying zone for the purposes of section 18(1) if the Secretary considers it necessary for security reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A relevant official may specify in a designation that the designation is to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during any hours in any day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on specified days;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during specified hours in any day; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: during specified hours in any specified days.

subsection.content: If different designations are made under different subsections in respect of an area and the designations are having effect, the area is to be regarded as a separate restricted flying zone in respect of each of the designations for the purposes of this Order.
A relevant official may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke a designation made by the official.
Any notice published under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6), a relevant official may publish the notice in a designated information system instead of the Gazette if the official considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is necessary to publish the notice as soon as practicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is impracticable in the circumstances to publish the notice in the Gazette.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a notice published under subsection (8) is regarded as having the same effect for all purposes as a notice published in the Gazette under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6) (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: designation ( 指定) means a designation made under subsection (1), (2) or (3);
relevant official (有關人員) means—(a)the Director;(b)the Commissioner of Police; or(c)the Secretary for Security.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Additional Requirements for Carriage of Dangerous Goods

section.name: s20
section.heading: Permission required for carriage of dangerous goods

subsection.content: A person must not cause or permit a small unmanned aircraft to carry any dangerous goods during a flight unless the dangerous goods are carried in accordance with a permission granted under section 37.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Offence for dangerous operation
section.content: A person who operates a small unmanned aircraft for a flight dangerously commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Offence for causing or permitting small unmanned aircraft to endanger person or property
section.content: A person who, recklessly or negligently, causes or permits a small unmanned aircraft to endanger any person or property during a flight commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Offence for interfering with small unmanned aircraft etc.

subsection.leadIn: If a small unmanned aircraft is being operated for a flight, a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: wilfully interfere with, or wilfully cause damage to, any part of—

subparagraph.content: the aircraft;
the device used to control the aircraft for the flight;
a component associated with the aircraft;
a component associated with the device mentioned in subparagraph (ii); or
anything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully interfere with the communication between the aircraft and the device used to control the aircraft for the flight.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Offence for operating prohibited small unmanned aircraft for flights

subsection.content: If a class or description of unmanned aircraft is prohibited from being operated for a flight under subsection (2), a person must not operate a small unmanned aircraft within that class or description for a flight.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, prohibit a class or description of unmanned aircraft from being operated for a flight if the Director considers it necessary in the interests of aviation safety or public safety.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke a prohibition made under subsection (2).
Any notice published under subsection (2) or (3) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2) or (3), the Director may publish the notice in a designated information system instead of the Gazette if the Director considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is necessary to publish the notice as soon as practicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is impracticable in the circumstances to publish the notice in the Gazette.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a notice published under subsection (5) is regarded as having the same effect for all purposes as a notice published in the Gazette under subsection (2) or (3) (as the case requires).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Registration of unmanned aircraft

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Director for the registration of an unmanned aircraft.
If the person is a natural person, the person must have attained the age of 18 years at the time of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to register the aircraft if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aircraft has already been registered and a person other than the applicant was named as the responsible person of the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is inappropriate to register the aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: On registering the aircraft, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: name the applicant as the responsible person of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant an SUA registration certificate in respect of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify on the certificate the validity period of the registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: assign to the aircraft a registration number and an identification mark; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant a label on which the registration number and the identification mark of the aircraft are shown.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (5)(c), the validity period must not exceed 5 years beginning on the date on which the SUA registration certificate is issued under subsection (5)(b) in respect of the aircraft.
A registration made under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Renewal of registration of unmanned aircraft

subsection.content: The responsible person of an unmanned aircraft may apply to the Director for the renewal of the registration of the aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not earlier than 4 months before the date on which the registration expires (expiry date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 1 year after the expiry date.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to renew the registration if the Director considers that it is inappropriate to renew the registration.

subsection.leadIn: On renewing the registration, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue to the responsible person of the aircraft an SUA registration certificate in respect of the aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify on the certificate the validity period of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)(b), the validity period must not exceed 5 years beginning on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application for renewal is made before the expiry date—the expiry date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application for renewal is made on or after the expiry date—the date on which the SUA registration certificate is issued under subsection (5)(a) in respect of the aircraft.

subsection.content: A registration renewed under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Responsible persons may apply for reissue of label

subsection.content: If the label issued under section 25(5)(e) in respect of a registered small unmanned aircraft is lost, defaced or destroyed, the responsible person of the aircraft may apply to the Director for the reissue of the label.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to reissue the label if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is not satisfied that the label was lost, defaced or destroyed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is inappropriate to reissue the label.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1) and sections 9(1)(f)(ii) and 11(1)(b), a label reissued under this section is regarded as issued under section 25(5)(e).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Power to vary, suspend or revoke registration
section.leadIn: The Director may vary, suspend or revoke the registration of a registered small unmanned aircraft in accordance with section 45, 46 or 47 respectively if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director reasonably suspects that the aircraft—

subparagraph.content: is unfit for flying;
is destroyed or missing;
has been seized under this Order; or
has been modified to a substantial extent that it can no longer be reasonably considered to be the same aircraft originally registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the responsible person of the aircraft has contravened a provision of this Order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the aircraft was registered as a result of an unlawful act of, or a false representation of a fact made by, the responsible person of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the registration has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the aircraft registered.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Registration of remote pilots

subsection.content: A person who has attained the age of 14 years may apply to the Director for the registration of the person as a registered remote pilot.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to register the person as a registered remote pilot if the Director considers that it is inappropriate to register the person as a registered remote pilot.

subsection.leadIn: On registering the person as a registered remote pilot, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue to the person a remote pilot certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify on the certificate the validity period of the registration.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (4)(b), the validity period must not exceed 3 years beginning on the date on which the remote pilot certificate is issued under subsection (4)(a) in respect of the person.
A registration made under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Renewal of registration of remote pilots

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Director for the renewal of the registration of the person as a registered remote pilot.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not earlier than 4 months before the date on which the registration expires (expiry date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 1 year after the expiry date.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to renew the registration if the Director considers that it is inappropriate to renew the registration.

subsection.leadIn: On renewing the registration, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue to the person a remote pilot certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify on the certificate the validity period of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)(b), the validity period must not exceed 3 years beginning on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application for renewal is made before the expiry date—the expiry date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application for renewal is made on or after the expiry date—the date on which the remote pilot certificate is issued under subsection (5)(a) in respect of the person.

subsection.content: A registration renewed under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Power to vary, suspend or revoke registration
section.leadIn: The Director may vary, suspend or revoke the registration of a person as a registered remote pilot in accordance with section 45, 46 or 47 respectively if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the person has contravened a provision of this Order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the person was registered as a result of an unlawful act of, or a false representation of a fact made by, the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the registration has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the person registered.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Assignment of rating

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Director for the assignment of a rating to the person for conducting certain types of flight operation specified by the Director under subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may only assign a rating to permit the person to conduct a type of flight operation if the Director considers that the person is fit for conducting the type of flight operation because of the person’s knowledge, experience and competence as may be necessary for conducting the type of flight operation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may request the person to take any training course approved or specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the person to undertake any assessment specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may assess the person’s knowledge, experience or competence for conducting the type of flight operation by any other means.

subsection.content: The Director must not assign a rating to the person unless the person is or will be a registered remote pilot on the date on which the rating takes effect.
On assigning the rating, the Director must issue to the person a remote pilot certificate specifying the rating.

subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise specified by the Director, a rating assigned to a person under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date on which the remote pilot certificate is issued under subsection (6) (effective date) in respect of the rating; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has effect until the expiry of the registration of the person as a registered remote pilot that is in force on the effective date.

subsection.content: The Director must specify and publish, in a way that the Director considers appropriate, the types of flight operation that a person is permitted to conduct under each rating.
A rating assigned under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Renewal of rating

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Director for the renewal of the person’s rating.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not earlier than 4 months before the date on which the registration of the person expires (expiry date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 1 year after the expiry date.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may only renew the rating to permit the person to conduct a type of flight operation if the Director considers that the person is fit for conducting the type of flight operation because of the person’s knowledge, experience and competence as may be necessary for conducting the type of flight operation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may request the person to take any training course approved or specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the person to undertake any assessment specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may assess the person’s knowledge, experience or competence for conducting the type of flight operation by any other means.

subsection.content: The Director must not renew the person’s rating unless the person is or will be a registered remote pilot on the date on which the renewed rating takes effect.
On renewing the rating, the Director must issue to the person a remote pilot certificate specifying the renewed rating.

subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise specified by the Director, the person’s rating renewed under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect on the following date (effective date)—

subparagraph.content: if the application for renewal is made before the expiry date—the expiry date; or
if the application for renewal is made on or after the expiry date—the date on which the remote pilot certificate is issued under subsection (7) in respect of the rating; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has effect until the expiry of the registration of the person as a registered remote pilot that is in force on the effective date.

subsection.content: A rating renewed under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Power to vary, suspend or revoke rating
section.leadIn: The Director may vary, suspend or revoke a rating assigned to a person in accordance with section 45, 46 or 47 respectively if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the person has contravened a provision of this Order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the rating was assigned as a result of an unlawful act of, or a false representation of a fact made by, the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director considers that the person is no longer fit for conducting the type of flight operation permitted by the rating;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the rating has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the rating assigned.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Power to approve training courses and course providers, and to authorize assessors

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 32(4) and 33(5), the Director may, on application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve a training course;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve a person to provide, organize or conduct a training course; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize a person to conduct any assessment.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in writing to the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: For determining an application under subsection (1), the Director may, by any means that the Director considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a)—assess the standard of the training course;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)—assess the applicant’s knowledge, experience and competence in providing, organizing or conducting a training course; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(c)—assess the applicant’s knowledge, experience and competence in conducting an assessment.

subsection.content: An approval or authorization granted under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

The Director may request a person approved or authorized under subsection (1)(b) or (c) to provide to the Director from time to time any report that the Director considers appropriate for the purposes of this section or section 32 or 33.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Power to vary, suspend or revoke approval or authorization
section.leadIn: The Director may vary, suspend or revoke an approval or authorization granted under section 35(1) in accordance with section 45, 46 or 47 respectively if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the applicant has contravened a provision of this Order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the approval or authorization was granted as a result of an unlawful act of, or a false representation of a fact made by, the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the approval or authorization has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the course or person approved or authorized.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Application for permission

subsection.leadIn: A person may apply to the Director for a permission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for operating a category B aircraft or category C aircraft for a flight; (L.N. 82 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for operating a small unmanned aircraft for a flight without complying with any or all of the operating requirements applicable to the aircraft;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for operating a small unmanned aircraft for a flight within a restricted flying zone; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for causing or permitting a small unmanned aircraft to carry any dangerous goods during a flight.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, for the purposes of subsection (1)(c), if section 19(5) applies in relation to the restricted flying zone concerned, the person is regarded as having made a separate application for a permission in respect of each of the restricted flying zones concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in accordance with section 39; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to grant the permission if the Director considers that it is inappropriate to grant the permission.

subsection.leadIn: If an application for a permission is made under subsection (1)(c) and the restricted flying zone concerned is an area in respect of which a designation under section 19(2) or (3) is having effect, the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must seek the advice of the Commissioner of Police or the Secretary for Security (as the case requires) in relation to the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must refuse to grant the permission if the Commissioner or the Secretary (as the case requires) considers that it is inappropriate to grant the permission.

subsection.content: A permission granted under this section may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Power to vary, suspend or revoke permission

subsection.leadIn: The Director may vary, suspend or revoke a permission granted to a person in accordance with section 45, 46 or 47 respectively if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the person has contravened a provision of this Order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the permission was granted as a result of an unlawful act of, or a false representation of a fact made by, the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the permission has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the permission granted.

subsection.content: However, if the permission was granted on the advice of the Commissioner of Police or the Secretary for Security under section 37(5)(a), the Director may only vary, suspend or revoke the permission on the advice of the Commissioner of Police or the Secretary for Security (as the case requires).

section.name: s39
section.heading: Requirements for applications made under this Part

subsection.content: An application made under this Part (other than an application made under section 35) must be made to the Director through a designated information system or by any other means specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a natural person, the application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include the name and address of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a copy of the proof of identity of the person.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a body corporate, the application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include the name and registered office address of the body corporate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a copy of the certificate of incorporation of the body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is an unincorporated body, the application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include the name and address of the unincorporated body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include the name and address of a natural person who is a partner in, or a manager of, or any other person concerned in the management of, the unincorporated body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a copy of the proof of identity of the natural person referred to in paragraph (b).

section.name: s40
section.heading: Power to require information and documentary proof
section.leadIn: For determining an application under this Part, the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Director considers it necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Duty to give reasons for refusal of application
section.content: If the Director refuses an application made under this Part, the Director must give written notice to the applicant stating the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Responsible persons and registered remote pilots must update information

subsection.content: The responsible person of a registered small unmanned aircraft must notify the Director of any change in the information or document provided to the Director under this Part in relation to the registration or renewal of registration of the aircraft.

A registered remote pilot must notify the Director of any change in the information or document provided to the Director under this Part in relation to the registration or renewal of registration, or the assignment or renewal of rating, of the person.
The notification must be made within 14 days after the date on which the change occurs.
The notification must be made to the Director through a designated information system or by any other means specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person or the registered remote pilot (as the case requires) must provide any information or documentary proof that the Director requires as proof of the change—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 14 days after receiving the Director’s request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the way specified by the Director.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Power to vary registration or rating in accordance with notification under section 42
section.content: If the Director is satisfied that the change specified in a notification made under section 42(1) or (2) has occurred, the Director may vary the registration or rating concerned in accordance with section 45.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Procedures for Cancellation, Variation, Suspension and Revocation

section.name: s44
section.heading: Cancellation of registration and rating

subsection.content: The responsible person of a registered small unmanned aircraft may request that the registration of the aircraft be cancelled.
A registered remote pilot may request that the registration or rating of the remote pilot be cancelled.
The request must be made to the Director through a designated information system or by any other means specified by the Director.
The cancellation takes effect on the date specified on the notice to be given by the Director to the responsible person or the registered remote pilot (as the case requires) on granting the request.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Procedures for variation of registration, rating, etc.
section.leadIn: If the Director decides to vary a registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission under section 28, 31, 34, 36, 38 or 43, the Director must give written notice to the person concerned stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission (as the case requires) as varied by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date from which the variation takes effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ground for the variation.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Procedures for suspension of registration, rating, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to suspend a registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission under section 28, 31, 34, 36 or 38, the Director must give written notice to the person concerned stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date from which the suspension takes effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the suspension; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the suspension ceases to have effect, or if the suspension is to cease to have effect on the occurrence of an event, this fact and the event.

subsection.leadIn: The suspension ceases to have effect on the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of a period of 180 days beginning on the date specified under subsection (1)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date or the occurrence of the event as specified under subsection (1)(c).

section.name: s47
section.heading: Procedures for revocation of registration, rating, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director intends to revoke a registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission under section 28, 31, 34, 36 or 38, the Director must give written notice to the person concerned stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the intended revocation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person’s right to make written representation under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, the Director may give written notice to the person under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not a notice is simultaneously given under section 46(1) to suspend the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: while a suspension of the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission concerned is in effect under section 46.

subsection.content: On receiving the written notice, the person may make written representation to the Director within 14 days after the service of the notice as to why the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission should not be revoked.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person does not make any written representation within the period specified in subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having considered the written representation made by the person under subsection (3), the Director still considers that the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission should be revoked.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director revokes the registration, rating, approval, authorization or permission, the Director must give written notice to the person stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date from which the revocation takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the revocation.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Appointment of authorized officers
section.content: The Director may, in writing, appoint a public officer or any other person to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Order.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Production of identification document required when performing function

subsection.content: When performing a function under this Order, an authorized officer must, if asked, produce for inspection an identification document that shows the officer’s identity as an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: function (職能) includes a power and a duty.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Enforcement Powers in Relation to Small Unmanned Aircraft and Flight Operations etc.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Power to prevent or stop flight operation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an authorized officer reasonably suspects that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under this Order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a small unmanned aircraft is being operated or is about to be operated for a flight, and—

subparagraph.content: the operation or the continued operation of the aircraft for the flight is likely to cause danger to any person or property; or
the aircraft is in a condition or location that is unfit for the flight.

subsection.leadIn: The officer may do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct the person not to cause or permit the aircraft to be operated for the flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause the aircraft to land;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take over the flight operation of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: seize and detain the aircraft to prevent it from being operated for the flight.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (2)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Power to prevent or stop interference with small unmanned aircraft etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is being operated or is about to be operated for a flight; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person is—

subparagraph.leadIn: interfering with or causing damage to, or about to interfere with or cause damage to, any part of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the aircraft;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the device used to control the aircraft for the flight;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a component associated with the aircraft;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a component associated with the device mentioned in sub-subparagraph (B); or

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: anything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft; or
interfering with, or about to interfere with, the communication between the aircraft and the device used to control the aircraft for the flight.

subsection.leadIn: The officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may direct the person to stop the act as described in subsection (1)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may stop that act or cause the person to stop that act.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (2)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Power to seize and detain aircraft and device etc.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that an offence under this Order has been committed, is being committed or is about to be committed in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight or about to be operated for a flight, the officer may seize and detain any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the device used to control the aircraft for the flight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a component associated with the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a component associated with the device mentioned in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: anything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that an offence under section 23(2) or 51(3) has been committed, is being committed or is about to be committed, the officer may seize and detain any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any device or article used for performing the act as described in section 23(1) or 51(1)(b) (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any component associated with the device or article.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a small unmanned aircraft is operated for a flight;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time during the flight, the aircraft or the device used to control the aircraft for the flight is within an area occupied by or under the control of the Hong Kong Garrison or the airspace above the area; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the area is a restricted flying zone,

subsection.continued: a member of the Hong Kong Garrison may exercise the power under subsection (1) within the area.

subsection.content: For the purpose of exercising the power under subsection (3), a member of the Hong Kong Garrison may also exercise the power under section 50(2)(b) or (c) within the area in relation to the aircraft.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Power to search and examine aircraft and device etc.

subsection.content: An authorized officer may search, examine, extract or collect any information contained in an aircraft, device, component or any other thing seized and detained under this Division.

However, if a specified appliance is seized and detained under this Division, an authorized officer must not search, examine, extract or collect any information contained in the appliance, except under the authority of a warrant issued under subsection (3).

A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to search, examine, extract or collect information contained in the specified appliance if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that there is in the appliance anything connected with an offence under this Order.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified appliance (指明裝置) means an electronic device that is likely to contain personal information, but does not include—(a)a small unmanned aircraft;(b)a device designed and used primarily for controlling the aircraft; or(c)anything installed in, carried by or attached to the aircraft.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Enforcement Powers in Relation to Documents and Information

section.name: s54
section.heading: Power to require personal particulars and proof of identity

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under this Order, the officer may require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide the person’s name, address and contact information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce the person’s proof of identity for inspection.

subsection.content: For the purpose of exercising the power under subsection (1), the officer may without warrant stop the person.
A person who fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Power to require disclosure of personal particulars of other persons related to flight operation

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that an offence under this Order has been committed, is being committed or is about to be committed in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight or about to be operated for a flight, the officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the person whom the officer reasonably suspects to be the specified person of the aircraft for the flight to provide to the officer the name, address and contact information of the person who has operated, is operating or is about to operate the aircraft for the flight; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require the person whom the officer reasonably suspects to have operated, be operating or be about to operate the aircraft for the flight to provide to the officer the name, address and contact information of the specified person of the aircraft for the flight.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is the specified person of the aircraft for the flight, and the person fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has operated, is operating or is about to operate the aircraft for the flight, and the person fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1)(b).

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士), in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight or about to be operated for a flight, means—(a)the responsible person of the aircraft at the time of the flight; or(b)any other person who knowingly causes or permits the aircraft to be operated for the flight.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Power to require production of documents or records etc.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that an offence under this Order has been committed, is being committed or is about to be committed in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight or about to be operated for a flight, the officer may require the person whom the officer reasonably suspects to be the specified person of the aircraft for the flight to produce any or all of the following (if applicable)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the SUA registration certificate issued in respect of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information recorded by the safety system in respect of the flight required to be kept under section 14(1) or (1A); (L.N. 82 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a permission or exemption granted by the Director in respect of the flight;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information relating to the flight.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has operated, is operating or is about to operate a small unmanned aircraft for a flight, the officer may require the person to produce any or all of the following (if applicable)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remote pilot certificate issued to the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information recorded by the safety system in respect of the flight required to be kept under section 14(1) or (1A); (L.N. 82 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a permission or exemption granted by the Director in respect of the flight;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information relating to the flight.

subsection.content: An authorized officer may inspect and make copy of a document or information produced to the officer under subsection (1) or (2).

If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a document or information produced to the officer under subsection (1) or (2) is or may contain evidence to which an offence under this Order has been committed, the officer may seize the document or information.

subsection.leadIn: For subsections (3) and (4), if the document or information is stored or is capable of being retrieved in the form of an electronic record, the officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the document or information be produced in a form in which it is either legible or capable of being retrieved on a computer and in which it can be removed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the officer is exercising a power under subsection (4)—may seize the material so produced.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is the specified person of the aircraft for the flight mentioned in subsection (1), and the person fails to comply with a requirement made under that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has operated, is operating or is about to operate the aircraft for the flight mentioned in subsection (2), and the person fails to comply with a requirement made under that subsection.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (6) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);

specified person (指明人士), in relation to a small unmanned aircraft operated for a flight or about to be operated for a flight, means—(a)the responsible person of the aircraft at the time of the flight; or(b)any other person who knowingly causes or permits the aircraft to be operated for the flight.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Offence for providing false or misleading information

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in relation to this Order, the person provides or produces any document or information that the person knows, or ought reasonably to have known, to be false or misleading in a material respect.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Offence for obstructing authorized officer

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person wilfully obstructs or impedes an authorized officer in the exercise of the powers of the officer under this Order.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Power to issue safety direction

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is of the opinion that a person has committed an offence under this Order (other than an offence under section 21, 22 or 58), the Director may issue a safety direction in writing to the person, requiring the person to do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to comply with the provision concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to take a corrective action that the Director considers necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to provide any information relating to the alleged offence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to take any training course or undertake any assessment that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The safety direction must specify the time limit for compliance with it.
The time limit must allow reasonable time for compliance.
The Director may, by written notice, vary or revoke the safety direction at any time.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Offence for not complying with safety direction

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person fails to comply with a safety direction issued to the person under section 59(1) within the time limit specified in the direction.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Review of decisions

subsection.leadIn: A person who is aggrieved by any of the following decisions may apply to the Director for review of the decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for registration of an unmanned aircraft under section 25;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for renewal of the registration of an unmanned aircraft under section 26;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for reissue of a label in respect of a registered small unmanned aircraft under section 27;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision to vary, suspend or revoke a registration of a registered small unmanned aircraft of which the person is the responsible person under section 28;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for registration of the person as a registered remote pilot under section 29;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for renewal of the registration of the person as a registered remote pilot under section 30;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a decision to vary, suspend or revoke a registration of the person as a registered remote pilot under section 31;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for assignment of a rating to the person under section 32;
a decision to refuse the person’s application for renewal of the person’s rating under section 33;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a decision to vary, suspend or revoke the person’s rating under section 34;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for approval of a training course or approval or authorization of the person under section 35;
a decision to vary, suspend or revoke an approval of a training course of which the person was the applicant or an approval or authorization granted to the person under section 36;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse the person’s application for a permission under section 37;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: a decision to vary, suspend or revoke a permission granted to the person under section 38.

subsection.content: The application must be made in writing within 14 days after the date of the decision.
Subject to subsection (4), if an application is made under subsection (1), the Director may confirm, vary or reverse the decision.

If the decision was made under section 37(5)(b) or 38(2), the Director may only confirm, vary or reverse the decision on the advice of the Commissioner of Police or the Secretary for Security (as the case requires).
The Director must issue a notice of the decision made under subsection (3) or (4) to the person who applied for review under subsection (1).
An application under subsection (1) for review of a decision does not suspend the decision unless the Director decides otherwise.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Appeals against decisions of Director

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by a decision made under section 61(3) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board.
A person who is aggrieved by a decision made under section 61(4) may appeal to the Chief Secretary for Administration.
An appeal under subsection (1) or (2) against a decision must be made within 14 days after the date of the decision.
An appeal under subsection (1) or (2) against a decision does not suspend the decision unless the Director decides otherwise.

section.name: s63
