section.heading: Power to issue safety requirements document

subsection.content: The Director may issue and publish a safety requirements document, in a way that the Director considers suitable, for providing guidance on the operation of any provisions of this Order, including guidance on how to comply with the requirements of this Order.
The Director may amend or revoke a safety requirements document at any time.
If the Director amends or revokes a safety requirements document, the Director must publish the amendment or revocation in the same way in which the document was published under subsection (1).
Any safety requirements document issued and published under subsection (1) or any amendment or revocation published under subsection (3) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Effect of safety requirements document

subsection.content: A person does not incur any criminal liability only because the person has contravened a provision of a safety requirements document.

subsection.leadIn: However, if, in any legal proceedings, the court is satisfied that a safety requirements document is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene a relevant provision of the document may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

subsection.content: In any legal proceedings, a document that purports to be a copy of a safety requirements document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be presumed to be a true copy of the safety requirements document.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) means a court of competent jurisdiction of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and includes—(a)a magistrate; and(b)the Administrative Appeals Board;
legal proceeding (法律程序) includes the proceedings before the Administrative Appeals Board.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Liability for responsible persons that are unincorporated bodies

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Order, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a responsible person commits an offence under this Order; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person is an unincorporated body,

subsection.continued: a person specified in subsection (2) commits the offence instead.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, at the time of the offence, was one of the following persons, is a person specified for subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partner in, or a manager of, or any other person concerned in the management of, the unincorporated body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a).

section.name: s66
section.heading: Defence

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under this Order (other than an offence under section 21, 22 or 58) to establish that, at the time of the alleged offence, the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for contravening the provision concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A person is taken to have established that the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for contravening the provision concerned if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the person had such lawful authority or reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Power to designate information system

subsection.content: The Director may designate an information system (designated information system) for the purposes of this Order.
The Director may designate different information systems for different purposes under subsection (1).

The Director must, as soon as practicable after designating an information system under subsection (1), publish the details of the designation in a way that the Director considers appropriate in the circumstances to bring it to the attention of the persons that the Director considers likely to use the system.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s68
section.heading: Power to exempt

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by written notice, exempt an unmanned aircraft or a person from any or all provisions of this Order, subject to any condition that the Director considers appropriate, if the Director considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a genuine operational need for the exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is reasonable in the circumstances to grant the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by written notice, vary, suspend or revoke an exemption granted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that the person to whom the exemption was granted has contravened a provision of this Order (other than the provision covered by the exemption);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director reasonably suspects that a condition of the exemption has been contravened; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director considers that it is no longer appropriate to have the exemption granted.

subsection.content: The Director must state in the written notice under subsection (2) the date from which the variation, suspension or revocation takes effect.

The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt a class or description of unmanned aircraft or persons from any or all provisions of this Order, subject to any condition that the Director considers appropriate.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, vary, suspend or revoke an exemption granted under subsection (4).
Any notice published under subsection (4) or (5) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Power to issue instruments electronically
section.leadIn: The Director may issue the following instruments in paper form or electronic form that the Director considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an SUA registration certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a remote pilot certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a permission granted under section 37;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a notice given under section 41, 44(4), 45, 46(1), 47(1) or (5), 61(5) or 68(1) or (2);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a safety requirements document issued under section 63.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Delegation of functions

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Director may delegate any of the Director’s functions under this Order to any public officer in the Civil Aviation Department.
The Director may delegate the Director’s function under section 48 or 59 to any public officer.
The Director must not delegate any of the Director’s functions under section 61 or 62 to the officer who made the decision that is being reviewed under section 61.
The Commissioner of Police may delegate any of the Commissioner’s functions under this Order to any police officer.
The Secretary for Security may delegate any of the Secretary’s functions under this Order to any public officer in the Security Bureau.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: function (職能) includes a power and a duty.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Fees

subsection.content: The fee prescribed for a matter described in column 3 of an item in the Schedule (that is payable under a provision of this Order set out in column 2 of that item) is the fee specified in column 4 of that item.
The Director may, in a particular case, reduce, waive or refund, in whole or in part, a fee payable or paid under this Order.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Transitional provision

subsection.content: During the transitional period, a contravention of section 11(1), 14(1), 15(1) or 42(1), (2) or (5) does not constitute an offence under section 11(4), 14(2), 15(3) or 42(6) respectively.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: transitional period (過渡期間) means the period beginning on 1 June 2022 and ending on 30 November 2022.
